p: Ammonification, nitrification and microbial immobilisation of inorganic N were approximately one order of magnitude larger than plant uptake ( Fig 6). Microbial biomass N was several times larger than the plant N pool ( Fig 6). Extractable soil NH 4 + and NO 3 - pools were in the magnitude of daily rates of gross inorganic N turnover. Nitrate was the dominant N source for beech seedlings in June, followed by NH 4 +, whereas organic N supplied as glutamine was hardly recovered ( Fig 6). Plant N uptake was generally larger in June than in August ( Fig 6).
